snippet: The Knicks, the N.B.A.’s oldest team, use more than 35 pounds of ice after some games, but Pablo Prigioni, a 35-year-old rookie from Argentina, does not partake.
abstract: Profile of New York Knicks 35-year-old point guard Pablo Prigioni, who counts on diet, exercise and adequate sleep for recovery purposes rather than ice; Prigioni has been the most durable of the older players the team signed in the off-season,  avoiding any significant injury.
lead_paragraph: The Knicks, the N.B.A.’s oldest team, use more than 35 pounds of ice after some games, but Pablo Prigioni, a 35-year-old rookie from Argentina, does not partake.

headline.seo: When the Knicks’ Pablo Prigioni Recovers, He Prefers to Forgo Ice
headline.main: On an Aching Roster, a Knick Prefers to Forgo Ice
headline.print_headline: On an Aching Roster, a Knick Prefers to Forgo Ice
